results.title: The Little men of Chromagnon = Les Bibites de Chromagnon
results.brief_description: An introduction for children to the primary colours and their combinations. Using animation the film shows little elf-like creatures making all the discoveries. They emerge from three circles painted red, yellow and blue. When they venture into a circle of another colour they find that they too change colour.

results.title: The Little Marsupials
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
This program that contains rare and sometimes unique footage of little marsupials, including the amazing Honey Possum. Includes footage of the Numbats which feed exclusively on termites. Rare and endangered, the Numbats are the subject of research sponsored by the World Wildlife Fund. Features the marsupial gliders and the rare Red-Tailed Wambenger.

results.title: The Little island
results.creator_credit: Richard Williams Films and Richard Williams
results.brief_description: An animated film exploring the potential for conflict between different views of life and its possible consequences. Three inhabitants of an island clash repeatedly over their respective devotion to the good, the true and the beautiful. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Little giraffe
results.brief_description: A charming cast of animated toys moves through a miniature town with comic inventiveness to seek first-aid for a sadly deflated toy giraffe at a gas station air pump.

results.title: The little chimney sweep
results.creator_credit: Richard Kaplan, Louis Hagen, Primrose Productions and Lotte Reiniger
results.brief_description: An example of Lotte Reiniger’s early silhouette films, re-cut and given a new sountrack. Tells the tale of a little chimney sweep from 18th century London who comes down the wrong chimney and meets a rich young heiress.

results.title: The Little airplane that grew
results.creator_credit: Pierre Rihouet and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A schoolboy daydreams in class. In his dream his model airlane becomes real and soars overhead performing breathtaking acrobatic feats.

results.title: The Litterbug
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Hamilton Luske
results.brief_description: Modern science continues to wage its war on pests of all type. But even science makes little progress against that contemptible pest - the litterbug. Who but Donald Duck should be better suited to portray this scourge of the cities beaches and mountains. With great skill, daring and deep dedication to his task, he methodically deposits his litter for all to see, happy in the realisation that no likely spot has been overlooked.
